intro: Brachystelma coddii, commonly known as the Codd's ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. It typically blooms in winter, producing pale pink or white flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts and conservationists.
